mcs201 Decision Control Statements

MCS201-DECISION-CONTROL-STATEMENTS

UNIT - 3: Decision and Loop Control Statements

‚úÖ Decision Control Statements

1. if-else Statement

Explanation: Conditional statements allow the program to make decisions and execute code blocks based on given conditions.

Ternary Form:

x = (y < 20) ? 9 : 10;

This means: If y is less than 20, assign 9 to x; otherwise, assign 10.

Standard Syntax:

if (condition) {
    // code block if condition is true
} else {
    // code block if condition is false
}

Example - Check Even or Odd:

if (a % 2 == 0) {
    printf("Even");
} else {
    printf("Odd");
}

2. switch Statement

Used when we have multiple conditions based on a single variable.

Syntax:

switch (a) {
    case 1:
        // statement;
        break;
    case 2:
        // statement;
        break;
    // ... other cases ...
    default:
        // statement if no case matches;
        break;
}

Example:

int choice = 2;
switch (choice) {
    case 1:
        printf("One");
        break;
    case 2:
        printf("Two");
        break;
    case 3:
        printf("Three");
        break;
    default:
        printf("Wrong choice");
        break;
}

üîÅ Loop Control Statements

Definition: A loop allows a set of instructions to be executed repeatedly until a specific condition is met.

1. while Loop

while (condition) {
    // code block
    // increment or decrement
}

2. do-while Loop

do {
    // code block
    // increment or decrement
} while (condition);

3. for Loop

for (initialization; condition; increment/decrement) {
    // code block
}

üßÆ Print Numbers 1 to 10

Using while loop:

int a = 1;
while (a <= 10) {
    printf("%d ", a);
    a++;
}

Using do-while loop:

int a = 1;
do {
    printf("%d ", a);
    a++;
} while (a <= 10);

Using for loop:

for (int a = 1; a <= 10; a++) {
    printf("%d ", a);
}

üß© Nested if Statements

Syntax:

if (condition1) {
    if (condition2) {
        // statement
    } else {
        // else block of inner if
    }
} else {
    // else block of outer if
}

Example - Student B.Tech Eligibility Check:

int q;  // qualification (class passed)
float m;  // marks

if (q >= 12 && m >= 75) {
    printf("WELCOME");
} else {
    printf("Unqualified!");
}

Detailed Feedback:

int q;
float m;

if (q >= 12) {
    if (m >= 75) {
        printf("You are qualified.");
    } else {
        printf("Your marks are too low.");
    }
} else {
    printf("You are underqualified.");
}
